byline.contributor: Jess Bidgood contributed reporting from Boston.

abstract: Hundreds of student activists stage sit-in at Robert Frost Library in Amherst College to protest racial tensions, joining many other colleges in demonstrations sweeping the country; Amherst administrators say they are willing to listen to list of demands even as alumni and others complain that students are asking for too much and are trying to stifle free speech.
lead_paragraph: Minority students at Amherst, like campus activists elsewhere, have made demands of administrators, and were met with not only sympathy, but criticism that they sought to stifle free speech and intellectual dissent.

headline.main: With Diversity Comes Intensity in Amherst Free Speech Debate
headline.print_headline: With Diversity Comes Intensity in Amherst Free-Speech Debate

snippet: Minority students at Amherst, like campus activists elsewhere, have made demands of administrators, and were met with not only sympathy, but criticism that they sought to stifle free speech and intellectual dissent.
